title: clef not starting up - FS scan times
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.10.15-stable
OS & Version: Windows 10 64-bit
Commit hash : ?

#### Expected behaviour
following this guide : https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/getting-started
I typed" clef --keystore "C:\Users\dlpst\AppData\Local\Ethereum\keystore" --chainid 3"
Then, put in my password and got FS scan times repeated after IPC endpoint opened

#### Actual behaviour
FS scan times repeated
I've been trying to get this running for weeks - please help. I didn't think starting this up was this problematic.
Thank you. See code below!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour


#### Backtrace

```
dlpst@DESKTOP-2HEVIJ9 MINGW64 /c/Program Files/Geth
$ clef --keystore "C:\Users\dlpst\AppData\Local\Ethereum\keystore" --chainid 3

WARNING!

Clef is an account management tool. It may, like any software, contain bugs.

Please take care to
- backup your keystore files,
- verify that the keystore(s) can be opened with your password.

Clef is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY;
without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

Enter 'ok' to proceed:
> ok

## Master Password

Please enter the password to decrypt the master seed
>
-----------------------

DEBUG[01-28|13:10:34.686] FS scan times                            list=0s set=0s diff=0s
DEBUG[01-28|13:10:34.713] Ledger support enabled
````

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.
What are you expecting to happen? As far as I see it, Clef indeed did start up and is waiting for requests over the network or IPC.

> What are you expecting to happen? As far as I see it, Clef indeed did start up and is waiting for requests over the network or IPC.

Hi @karalabe thanks for the response. When I ran Clef, it was doing "FS scan times" for like 2-3 minutes then i stopped it. How long does that need to run for?
That's just a debug log, not really important. It's started.
@holiman Any particular reason for printing the file system scan times?

@karalabe thank you again for the response. so i just ran clef again and it just keeps on giving me that fs scan times message over and over again...according to the documentation; my next step is to run "geth --goerli --syncmode "light" --http --signer=<CLEF_LOCATION>/clef.ipc" from https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/getting-started......in this case i want to sync ropsten...but it isnt even allowing me to type anything as it just keeps on giving me that fs scan times message over and over againwhat am i doing wrong?
@karalabe any update to this sir? how long should FS scan times run for? i cannot type anything as it just repeats
@karalabe @holiman  any update to this? I really want to get this up and running
Clef is one process, geth is another. You need to run both. You've started clef, now open a new terminal and start geth

@holiman @karalabe awesome thanks! now can you help me please find where clef.ipc is? i searched my folder and only found clef.exe in my geth folder and go bin? nowhere else? I'm typing this command but getting this error:

"$ geth --ropsten --syncmode "snap" --http --signer="C:/Program Files/Geth/clef.ipc""

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96163075/152089144-4857890c-c9ea-48bb-9200-45cc240caeed.png)

thanks in advance

@karalabe @holiman  it says that my clef url is "url=\\.\pipe\clef.ipc" ??? what does that mean? i cant find that anywhere. do i paste that in "<clef_location> in the command "geth --ropsten --syncmode "snap" --http --signer=<CLEF_LOCATION>/clef.ipc
On windows the IPC endpoint does not look like a regular file, it has that weird path. `\\.\pipe\clef.ipc`, just pass that to Geth.

@karalabe hi there. thank you - can you elaborate a bit? what exactly should i be typing in the clef location above? my geth path location? because that doesnt work. there is no clef.ipc in my geth path. Please let me know what i should type in "geth --ropsten --syncmode "snap" --http --signer=<CLEF_LOCATION>/clef.ipc"

thank you
`\\.\pipe\clef.ipc`

I did that and still got an error? what am i ytping wrong @karalabe ? thanks in advance
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96163075/152203681-52a4235a-09b8-47c7-98e3-0d7e673f6142.png)

I also tried the following @karalabe 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96163075/152203943-7f8bd361-f534-487c-bb8c-29713a288688.png)
@karalabe okay wow got it to work - i had to type "\\\.\pipe\clef.ipc" with three backslahes? not sure why - the full string should have been passed in the quotes. chain is now syncing thanks!

@karalabe @holiman hello again - following the documentation here but hitting an error on finding the balance for the wallet?/ it says the method eth_getBalance does not exist/is not avalable? I typed it exactly as it says in the docs? can i ask what am i doing wrong? what should i type instead? why is the instructions documents wrong? please and thank you....
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96163075/152262205-4ccdc7cc-131e-40b7-b5c0-c3ee5408a22e.png)
@karalabe @holiman hey guys - appreciate the help here - can you provide guidance as to why the command exactly shown in the documents is gving me an error screenshotted above?
@karalabe @holiman hey there. Any idea why the above command isnt working?

@davidlp94 is that the `console` (as in `geth ...args.. console`) or the remote-console (as in `geth attach http://localhost:8545`)? If it's the latter, might be that you haven't exposed the `eth` rpc service? What modules does it say is available in the console welcome message?
Original issue (and most secondary issues?) answered, closing

> On windows the IPC endpoint does not look like a regular file, it has that weird path. `\\.\pipe\clef.ipc`, just pass that to Geth.

This should **definitely** be noted in the [documentation](https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/getting-started).
